intro: Pseudobastardia, commonly known as the false bastardia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage, which often contain compounds with medicinal properties. The plants typically grow in temperate regions and are often found in woodland or grassland habitats. They have a taproot system and are known for their ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Due to their ornamental value and potential pharmacological uses, some species are cultivated for horticultural and traditional medicine purposes.
